properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the network.

properties.name: vlan_id
properties.description: • vlan_id - a vlan id to associate with the network. Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: • regions - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The id of the network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: dhcp
properties.description: • dhcp - (Optional) Enable DHCP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false. _

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) First ip for this region. Changing this value recreates the subnet.

properties.name: end
properties.description: • end - (Required) Last ip for this region. Changing this value recreates the subnet.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Required) Global network in CIDR format. Changing this value recreates the subnet

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - The region in which the network subnet will be created. Ex.: "GRA1". Changing this value recreates the resource.

properties.name: no_gateway
properties.description: • no_gateway - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP. Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - A description associated with the user.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the network.

properties.name: vlan_id
properties.description: • vlan_id - a vlan id to associate with the network. Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: • regions - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: • network_id - (Required) The id of the network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: dhcp
properties.description: • dhcp - (Optional) Enable DHCP. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false. _

properties.name: start
properties.description: • start - (Required) First ip for this region. Changing this value recreates the subnet.

properties.name: end
properties.description: • end - (Required) Last ip for this region. Changing this value recreates the subnet.

properties.name: network
properties.description: • network - (Required) Global network in CIDR format. Changing this value recreates the subnet

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - The region in which the network subnet will be created. Ex.: "GRA1". Changing this value recreates the resource.

properties.name: no_gateway
properties.description: • no_gateway - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP. Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - A description associated with the user.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) The domain to add the record to

properties.name: subdomain
properties.description: (Required) The name of the record

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) The value of the record

properties.name: fieldtype
properties.description: (Required) The type of the record

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The TTL of the record
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) The domain to add the redirection to

properties.name: subdomain
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the redirection

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) The value of the redirection

properties.name: list description
visible
properties.description: -> Redirection by http code 302

properties.name: visiblePermanent
properties.description: -> Redirection by http code 301

properties.name: invisible
properties.description: -> Redirection by html frame

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of this redirection

properties.name: keywords
properties.description: (Optional) Keywords to describe this redirection

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Optional) Title of this redirection
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: ip
properties.description: (Required) The IP block to which the IP belongs

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: (Required) The value of the reverse

properties.name: ipreverse
properties.description: (Optional) The IP to set the reverse of, default to ip if ip is a /32 (IPv4) or a /128 (IPv6)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing

properties.name: balance
properties.description: Load balancing algorithm. roundrobin if null (first, leastconn, roundrobin, source)

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: Readable label for loadbalancer farm

properties.name: port
properties.description: Port attached to your farm ([1..49151]). Inherited from frontend if null

properties.name: stickiness
properties.description: Stickiness type. No stickiness if null (sourceIp)

properties.name: vrack_network_id
properties.description: Internal Load Balancer identifier of the vRack private network to attach to your farm, mandatory when your Load Balancer is attached to a vRack

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) Zone where the farm will be defined (ie. GRA, BHS also supports ALL)

properties.name: list description
type
properties.description: (Required) Valid values : http, internal, mysql, oko, pgsql, smtp, tcp

properties.name: interval
properties.description: probe interval, Value between 30 and 3600 seconds, default 30

properties.name: match
properties.description: What to mach pattern against (contains, default, internal, matches, status)

properties.name: port
properties.description: Port for backends to recieve traffic on.

properties.name: negate
properties.description: Negate probe result

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: Pattern to match against match

properties.name: force_ssl
properties.description: Force use of SSL (TLS)

properties.name: url
properties.description: URL for HTTP probe type.

properties.name: method
properties.description: HTTP probe method (GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, internal)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing

properties.name: farm_id
properties.description: ID of the farm this server is attached to

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: Label for the server

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the backend server (IP from either internal or OVH network)

properties.name: status
properties.description: backend status

properties.name: port
properties.description: Port that backend will respond on

properties.name: proxy_protocol_version
properties.description: version of the PROXY protocol used to pass origin connection information from loadbalancer to recieving service (v1, v2, v2-ssl, v2-ssl-cn)

properties.name: weight
properties.description: used in loadbalancing algorithm

properties.name: probe
properties.description: defines if backend will be probed to determine health and keep as active in farm if healthy

properties.name: ssl
properties.description: is the connection ciphered with SSL (TLS)

properties.name: backup
properties.description: is it a backup server used in case of failure of all the non-backup backends
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: Human readable name for your frontend, this field is for you

properties.name: port
properties.description:
Port(s) attached to your frontend. Supports single port (numerical value), 
range (2 dash-delimited increasing ports) and comma-separated list of 'single port' 
and/or 'range'. Each port must be in the [1;49151] range

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Required) Zone where the frontend will be defined (ie. gra, bhs also supports all)

properties.name: allowed_source
properties.description: Restrict IP Load Balancing access to these ip block. No restriction if null. List of IP blocks.

properties.name: dedicated_ipfo
properties.description: Only attach frontend on these ip. No restriction if null. List of Ip blocks.

properties.name: default_farm_id
properties.description: Default TCP Farm of your frontend

properties.name: default_ssl_id
properties.description: Default ssl served to your customer

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disable your frontend. Default: 'false'

properties.name: ssl
properties.description: SSL deciphering. Default: 'false'
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: Human readable name for your route, this field is for you

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Route priority ([0..255]). 0 if null. Highest priority routes are evaluated first. Only the first matching route will trigger an action

properties.name: action.status
properties.description: HTTP status code for "redirect" and "reject" actions

properties.name: action.target
properties.description: Farm ID for "farm" action type or URL template for "redirect" action. You may use ${uri}, ${protocol}, ${host}, ${port} and ${path} variables in redirect target

properties.name: action.type
properties.description: (Required) Action to trigger if all the rules of this route matches

properties.name: frontend_id
properties.description: Route traffic for this frontend
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing

properties.name: route_id
properties.description: (Required) The route to apply this rule

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: Human readable name for your rule, this field is for you

properties.name: field
properties.description: (Required) Name of the field to match like "protocol" or "host". See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules" for a list of available rules

properties.name: match
properties.description: (Required) Matching operator. Not all operators are available for all fields. See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules"

properties.name: negate
properties.description: Invert the matching operator effect

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: Value to match against this match. Interpretation if this field depends on the match and field

properties.name: sub_field
properties.description: Name of sub-field, if applicable. This may be a Cookie or Header name for instance
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vrack_id
properties.description: • vrack_id - (Required) The id of the vrack. If omitted, the OVH_VRACK_ID environment variable is used.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vrack_id
properties.description: • vrack_id - (Required) The id of the vrack. If omitted, the OVH_VRACK_ID environment variable is used.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: • project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the OVH_PROJECT_ID environment variable is used.
